text:
“Good heavens! Have I slept so long?” Raskolnikov asked.

“Yes, brother. Six hours,” Razumihin replied. 

“Why the hurry?” 

Razumihin chuckled. “I’ve been waiting for you. I called on Zossimov twice.”

Raskolnikov frowned. “How long have you been coming here?”

“I told you this morning,” Razumihin said. 

Raskolnikov struggled to remember. 

“Ah, you’ve forgotten,” Razumihin observed. “You’re better now, though. First-rate! Let’s get to business.” 

He gestured to the parcel. 

“How do you feel now?” 

“I am quite well,” Raskolnikov said, shaking off the fog.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov wakes up from a long sleep to find Razumihin waiting for him and discussing their plans.
